channel.title: Assignments on Machine Learning for the Geosciences
channel.description: Recent content in Assignments on Machine Learning for the Geosciences

item.title: 03 | Version control
item.description:
Objective(s)

To practice the git operations we discussed in class.

  1. Clone the course repository.

  2. Create a new branch.

  3. Add a .md file under the participants directory that contains your:

    • Name
    • Graduation year
    • Major

    Note: Each parameter should be under a h2 heading.

  4. Commit your changes and push your branch to the origin.

  5. Submit a pull request.

  6. Approve someone else’s pull request.

Notes

In this case, you have write access to the repository. However, there will be times where you want to contribute to a project but lack the ability to modify the repository directly. In such cases, you should fork, create a branch, make changes, and then submit a pull request. You are welcome to use this so-called “fork and pull request” workflow for this assignment (i.e., as opposed to cloning the repository directly).

item.title: 02 | Student introductions
item.description:
Objectives

In order to develop collaborations and, ultimately, assemble groups for the final project, it is important to know something about your fellow students.

For this assignment, you will assemble up to two slides that tell us:

  1. Your name.
  2. Your department.
  3. An aspect of the geosciences that especially interests you.
  4. Your long-term goals.
  5. Experiences you may have with AI/ML.

Please put your completed slides into this document You should feel free to edit directly in the document.

item.title: 01 | Setup
item.description:
Objectives

  • Install Microsoft Visual Studio Code1 on your computing platform.
  • Create a Github account (if you do not already have one).
  • Provide your Github username using this form.

Deadline

You should complete these tasks by 1:00 PM on Wednesday, January 7.

  1. While I will use Visual Studio Code for instruction, you are also welcome to install the integrated development environment (IDE) of your choice. â†©
